```{r setup, include=FALSE}
knitr::opts_chunk$set(echo = TRUE)

library(knitr) ; library(kableExtra)

options(knitr.table.format = "html")

# set up ------------------------------------------------------------------

library(tidyverse)

## @knitr captures

captures <-
  read_csv('nocaReport/captureTable.csv')

names(captures) <-
  str_replace_all(names(captures), 'Capture', '')

noca <-
  captures %>%
  filter(spp == 'NOCA') %>%
  select(siteID, date, enc, bandNumber, mass:sex)



# Function to add region to a plot (based on siteId field):

addRegion <- function(x){
  xState <- str_sub(x, start = -3, end = -2)
  case_when(
    xState == 'GA' ~ 'Atlanta',
    xState == 'CO' ~ 'Colorado',
    xState == 'FL' ~ 'Gainesville',
    xState == 'NC' ~ 'Raleigh',
    xState == 'PA' ~ 'Pittsburgh',
    xState == 'MA' ~ 'Springfield',
    xState %in% c('MD','DC', 'VA') ~ 'Washington, DC',
    TRUE ~ 'noData'
  )
}

# Functions to detect outliers:

outlierBottom <- function(x){
  median(x) - 2.5*mad(x)
}

outlierTop <- function(x){
  median(x) + 2.5*mad(x)
}
```

<hr>
<h2><b>Some summary plots</b></h2>

```{r massPlot, echo = FALSE, results = 'asis', fig.width = 8, fig.asp = .5}
noca %>%
  mutate(region = addRegion(siteID)) %>%
  filter(
    sex %in% c('M', 'F'),
    between(mass, outlierBottom(mass), outlierTop(mass))) %>%
  mutate(sex = factor(sex, labels = c('Female', 'Male'))) %>%
  ggplot(aes(x = region, y = mass)) +
  geom_boxplot(aes(fill = region)) +
  facet_wrap(~sex) +
  labs(title = 'Northern Cardinal body mass by region',
       x = 'Mass (g)',
       y = 'Region') +
  coord_flip() +
  scale_y_continuous(expand = c(0,0),
                     limits = c(30, 55)) +
  theme_bw() +
  theme(
    panel.spacing.x = unit(1, "lines")
  )
```
<br>

```{r massWing, echo = FALSE, results = 'asis', fig.width = 8, fig.asp = .5}

noca %>%
  mutate(region = addRegion(siteID)) %>%
  mutate(tl = as.numeric(tl)) %>%
  filter(tl < 200) %>%
  filter(
    sex %in% c('M', 'F'),
    between(mass, outlierBottom(mass), outlierTop(mass)),
    between(wing, outlierBottom(wing), outlierTop(wing))) %>%
  mutate(sex = factor(sex, labels = c('Female', 'Male'))) %>%
  ggplot(aes(x = mass, y = wing)) +
  geom_point(aes(color = region), alpha = 0.2) +
  stat_smooth(aes(color = region, fill = region), method = 'glm') +
  facet_wrap(~sex) +
  labs(title = 'Northern Cardinal mass:wing by region',
       x = 'Mass (g)',
       y = 'Wing (mm)') +
  theme_bw() +
  theme(
    panel.spacing.x = unit(1, "lines")
  )
```
